name: Mai Tai
about: The Mai Tai was created by Victor J. Bergeron (aka Trader Vic) in 1944 for friends visiting from Tahiti. When they tasted it, one exclaimed 'Mai Tai Roa Ae!' which means 'Out of this world! The best!' in Tahitian.
instructions: Add all ingredients except the dark rum to a shaker with crushed ice
Pour unstrained into a double old fashioned glass
Float the dark rum on top
Garnish with a mint sprig and spent lime shell
notes: The original Mai Tai used a now-extinct 17-year-old J. Wray & Nephew rum. Modern versions use a blend of aged Jamaican rum and rhum agricole to approximate that flavor profile.
garnish: Mint Sprig and Spent Lime Shell
